messages.subject: Buck Turgidson/DONATION FOR GOD'S WORK
messages.body:
Beloved in Christ, 

 

Calvary greetings in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, I am Mr JOHN BLAZZA I am 72years old, I am now a new Christian convert, suffering from long time cancer of the breast. From all indications, my condition is really deteriorating and is quite 
obvious that I may not live more than six months, because the cancer stage has gotten to a very severe stage. 

My late wife was killed during the Gulf war, and during the period of our marriage we had a son who was also killed in a cold blood during the Gulfwar. My late wife was very wealthy and after his death, I inherited all his business and alth. My personal physician told me that I may not live for more than six months and I am so scared about this. So, I now decided to divide part of this wealth, by contributing to the development of evangelism in Africa, America, Europe and Asian countries.


This mission which will no doubt be tasking had made me to recently relocated to togo, Africa where I live presently. I selected your church after visiting the website for this purpose and prayed over it, I am willing to donate the sum of $2.500,000.00 Million US Dollars to your church/Ministry for the development of 
evangelism and also as aids for the less privileged around you. 

 

please note that, this fund is lying in a bank (B.T.C.I BANK) in LOME therefore I will want you to contact the bank through this contact information: (btcitgc@financier.com) ;so that they will file an immediate application for the transfer of the money in the name of your ministry and they will tell you what steps to take next. 

 

Please, do not reply if you have the intention of using this fund for personal use other than enhancement of evangelism. Lastly, I want your ministry to be praying for me as regards my entire life and my health because I have come to find out since my spiritual birth lately that wealth acquisition without Jesus Christ in one's life is vanity upon vanity If you have to die says the Lord, keep fit and I will give you the crown of life. 

 

May the Grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, the love of God, and the sweet

Fellowship of the Holy Spirit been with you.I am waiting your urgent reply.

 

Yours in Christ,

 

OLD MAN JOHN BLAZZA 

 

FROM LOME TOGO.

messages.subject: RE: Buck Turgidson/DONATION FOR GOD'S WORK
messages.body:
CC :           btcitgc@financier.com

Mr. Blazza,

I am very touched by your email.  Your situation sounds terrible, but remember, all things are possible!

My name is Buck Turgidson (though I understand you already have this information).  While it is a mystery to me how you got in contact with me, I am more than willing to assist.  I do not have a ministry of myself, but I am active in several organizations which could make excellent use of these funds.  Would it be acceptable to proceed with the understanding that I would transfer any money to individual organizations as donations?

Please inform me of what additional information you may need.

I am copying the bank on this email message so that they may be informed of your request and being any machinations required for setup of the donations.

Best regards and wishes for your health,

Buck

I was confused about the exact amount we are talking about.  In the email, Mr. Blazza mentioned $2.500,000.00 Million US Dollars.  This does not really make sense, as the commas and the periods are mixed up.  Maybe this is an international way of representing money?  Please forgive my ignorance.  Is the amount $2,500,000.00 (2.5 million) or is it $2,500 (two thousand five hundred) or 2,5 Million?

In any case, I am prepared to move ahead with this.  You requested some information about me:

Buck Turgidson
23 Skidoo Ln
West Poplar, Wa.
206-339-xxxx

I don't have a passport.  Do I need one to open an account at your bank?  I can get one, but it may take a while.  I'd like to complete this transaction as quickly as possible. I am taking a little vacation over this coming weekend.  Do you think it might be possible to complete the transfer of money by Friday?

Best regards,
Buck

messages.body:
Jonh,

Have no fear, many things are possible!

I am glad to hear your sickness is not of the brean, but of the heart.  It means you will be able to continue communications with the bank on this matter. Trust and constancy is important and competence is a prerequisite.  We would not want this to fall apart because your mental state is challenged, would we?

The bank has asked me to provide them a passport, which I do not have.  As an alternative, they are requesting I contact another party to act as intermediary.  I am beginning to wonder if we can get this money transferred by this weekend, as there is a third party we must involve now. However, I don't think you need to call them at the moment, as they appear to be proceeding well.

My short vacation will start this Friday, so we will try to get things wrapped up before then, if not, we will try to finish up early next week.  I will do a little research on places to invest the money and let you know what I come up with.

Best wishes and condolences,

Buck

PS I told my girlfriend about this, I hope it is OK.  She is very hot, but a little dumb so I do not think she will tell anyone as I agree that security and confidentiality are utmost.

Buck is still confused about the amount of money. It just doesn't add up.

messages.body:
Ms. Kayas,

There is no need to shout.  I can read your email without the special effects.

You confused me again about the amount.  Your email says it is $2.500,000.  That is two dollars and 50 cents, with some extra zeros. You also state that it is "two million five hundred dollars", which would be $2,000,500.00.  That doesn't match with the numbers, either.  I will proceed under the assumption that we are talking about two million five hundred thousand dollars.

In any case, I will contact this Kenneth fellow and see if he can get the paperwork straight.  Mr. Blazza appears to be in failing health and it is important to make sure we don't delay this any longer.  I need the commission on this money.

Will there be any legal documents I must sign that will describe where the money must be invested, or will it simply be transferred to me?  It would be easier, of course, to transfer the money to me, then I can make the decisions on donations at my leisure. My gzirlfriend would help in this regard, of course.

Felicitations,
Buck

messages.body:
Mr. Kenneth,

The BTCI bank has recommended that I contact you.  I am not sure how to describe the transaction we need help with.  I have included the letter from the bank in this email, can you contact them and figure out what they want?  It involves the transfer of some money from Mr. Blazza.  This bank officer has gotten in the middle of it, and is being very rigid about the whole thing.

Also, I will rely on you to make sure this is done properly and clearly.  The bank officer appears to be a rather sloppy individual who can't even get the amount straight.  As Mr. Blazza is very ill and apparently not capable of watching this transaction in detail, if you could act as intermediary to assure that all paperwork and other items are in line and that no mistakes are made, I would appreciate it very much.

By the way, where are you located?  If you are in the same country as the bank, it might help things along.

Best regards,
Buck Turgidson

I am very upset.  As I mentioned in the earlier email, the lady at the mail station had some difficulty sending the money.  She claimed there was no such country as Lome, and that the missing phone number of the recipient would also cause problems.  But she took my money anyway.

Well, the whole thing bounced!  It was not done properly after all.  So, the money was refunded to me this morning when I went down there.

At this point, I can try doing one of two things.  If you can correct the address, and provide me with a phone number for yourself, I can re-try sending this through western union. That will slow things down terribly, but I don't know what else to do.

If you can get back to me in the next couple of hours, I may be able to make it back down there today.

Regards
Buck T.

messages.body:
Dear Jonh,

Have no fear, few things are possible!

The attempt to send money via western union failed.  I am afraid this failure was on the part of the local mail stop store, the person there was not very familiar with sending money via western union.  The lawyer also gave me incomplete information, which confused the agent even more.  I have the complete information now, but rather than try again, it appears that the lawyer wants me to send the money to a special bank account in Spain.

So, we will do our best to get this completed.  Once we get the Lawyer, Mr. Kenneth, his money, I am sure all will go smoothly, so that you can be at peace.

I will keep you abraided,

Buck

messages.body:
Jonh,

I am not comfortable with this situation at all.  The lawyer does not appear to be operating in good faith.  He has directed me to send funds to a bank in Spain, of all places.  This sounded suspicious, as this transaction is supposed to be in Africa, what is the lawyer doing in Spain of all places...  I am not sure that this place is even a real bank, but is maybe a front for some sort of scam.

I did not want to worry you about this, as your health is not good. But I think I must go back to the bank and ask them how we can proceed because this lawyer is not working out.

This is really depressing me; I think I need to get a drink to calm my nerves.

Buck

messages.subject: Difficulties with lawyer
messages.body:
Mrs. Kayes,

The lawyer to whom you referred me to assist in the transaction for Mr. Jonh Blazza, does not appear to be acting in good faith.  He has redirected me from your bank to some bank in Spain.  I do not trust him.

I know that Mr. Blazza is ill, and we must act quickly before he dies.  His last desire is to complete this transfer of money.  Is there some other means by which we can finish?  Is there another lawyer, or can I deal directly with you?  It seems it would be much simpler than involving third parties that operate from other countries than either you or I live in.

Please advise me how we can continue, as I do not want Mr. Blazza to be concerned and wish for this to be concluded quickly.

Buck Turgidson

messages.body:
Greetings in the name of Moroni,

Have no fear, nothing is possible!

It appears that the bank is insisting that I deal with this lawyer guy.  I am not happy about this, but there is too much at stake here, I guess I will continue. Please, be aware that there may be something strange about some aspects of this transaction with the lawyer, I will try to make sure that nothing unfortunate happens.  The bank is actively working to slow this transaction so that they can keep the money as long as possible, and the lawyer may be trying to set it up to move the money through Spain, and maybe even keep some of it.  I will do what I can to make sure that the transfer is completed properly and successfully.

I have a terrible hangover.  I think I drank too much last night.  I may have to cancel my trip to the Chicken Ranch, if I don't get better.  Lord, my head hurts.  But, then, I feel guilty complaining about my hangover, because you must be in even more of a world of hurt with your sickness. Don't worry - I will work to make your wet dream come true as well.

I must sleep for a while before I try to work with the lawyer again.  Get my head clear.  I need my wits.  And my girlfriend.  She can help, always does.

As always, I will keep you informed of our progress.

All the best,
Buck

messages.body:
Jonh,

Good to hear from you.  Thanks for your best wishes for Heidi and myself.  I am planning on selling my current business, FlyByNight Tours, and invest the money in a Nevada based Ranch.  We can recruit some of the girls from the other ranches.  An exciting venture. The tour company wasn't making much money anyway, business dropped off after that last crash.  Pictures in the paper were gruesome.

Cost for the round trip appears to be at least $4,000!  Due to the pending sale of my current business, I won't be able to travel for about a week. An idea had just occurred to me though. Buck

messages.body:
Jonh,

Thanks for your support. Heidi will not be coming, as the extra weight will require extra fuel. Not that she is fat - please don't think that!  It's just that with this long of a trip fuel calculations are precise.

The schedule I have for the trip has me leaving Homestead Friday afternoon.  After several hops across the Caribbean, I will jump to Ascension Island and refuel.  From there I will make my way to Ghana.  Arrival is planned for Tuesday April 5 at about 4 or 5 in the evening.  Please note - I will be arriving at TAMALE airport, as the larger international airports are sometimes unfriendly to private aircraft.  Please inform Suleman of this fact.

Also - the Maglab hotel will not be acceptable.  It is only a two star hotel, and I am not comfortable going to a foreign country and staying in anything less than a 4 star hotel.  Please change the reservations.  Also, please send a copy of the reservation for me to keep with me.

Modifications on my Ryan are coming along well.  I have decided to name it after my home town, St. Louis.

Buck

messages.body:
Jonh,

I am coming alone, as I mentioned before Heidi will not come with me though she is definitely not fat. Yes, I know that I am coming there as a vacation and see the sights.  In fact, I may bring my hunting rifle and maybe see if I can hunt some big game while I am there.  I've flown many places, but never been to Africa.  That sounds like a great sight seeing activity.  What do you recommend?  I have a Weatherby 270 Magnum that can be used for bigger game.  I also have a Ruger Mini 30 (hand gun), though accuracy is kind of poor with it. It's not really for hunting. I could probably link up with a safari company while I am there.

Please have Mr. Suleman make reservations under my name. No one else will be with me.

Buck

PS I am now completely healed.

messages.body:
Jonh,

Wow, what a trip.

I am currently in Natal, Brazil.  It is my last waypoint before striking off across the Atlantic. I have borrowed the computer of a nice airport manager at the small civil airport here to send you email. I did not receive your last email before I left.  The cell phone is a lost cause; it does not work outside the US, so no point in bringing it.  As for the guns, too late.  I am hiding them in the back of the aircraft and I hope this will be OK unless someone searches.

I will be delayed by about a day due to weather / headwinds.  My next step is to Freetown (Sierra Leone).  I will attempt to get in contact when I reach Freetown.  Does Mr. Suleman carry his phone with him at all times?  I am getting completely confused about the time zones.

My arrival is currently scheduled for 2:00 - 3:00 on Wednesday at TAMALE.

I must sleep now before I set off.

Buck

Sad, sad news. Buck's airplane blew up over Cote d'Ivoire, raining wrist watches and handsets on the villagers. But he remembered Jonh in his will. Jonh is invited to work with the lawyer if he wants to acquire this inheritance.

messages.body:
Date       Thu, 7 Apr 2005 9:40 AM  

From       "Charles Addams" 

To           jonesbla@latinmail.com

Subject   Mr. Buck Turgidson

 

Mr. Blazza,

This letter may come to you as a surprise, but I assure you it is an
unusual circumstance for myself as well.

My name is Charles Addams, and I am the family lawyer for Mr. Buck
Turgidson. Based on some evidence I have from some printed email
messages, your address in his address book, and his last will and
testament, I believe you knew him and were in the process of transacting
some business with him.

It is my very unfortunate duty to inform you that we received word a few
hours ago that Mr. Turgidson is missing and presumed dead in a plane
crash over Cote d'Ivoir, West Africa.  He was flying from Freetown
Sierra Leone, to some location in Ghana (we believe Accra, though his
plans had changed in route).  His plane exploded about 419 miles out
from Freetown.  Reports from the area indicate that there was a huge
fireball, an explosion which was both terrible and beautiful to behold,
followed by a rain of debris from the aircraft which inexplicably
included a large number of watches and handsets.

I am reviewing items in his office, getting his affairs in order to
assist his girlfriend and prepare for the worst when we are told
officially of his death.  He apparently thought highly of you.  I say
this for a number of reasons.  These reasons include the fact that he
had spoken to me of you briefly, that he had your address and phone
number in his address books, and had been conducting some correspondence with you.  His girlfriend also remembers his mentioning you to her.

While I truly regret delivering this bad news, I need to let you know
how Mr. Turgidson felt about you.  Apparently he felt strongly enough
that he actually had me alter his will before he left on his trip to
Africa.  While he was not a rich man, he was in the process of selling
his tour company, and this sale is expected to complete in the next week or so.  It should bring in a little more than $2.5 million, including sale of his remaining aircraft.  While you are not his sole heir, he did leave a significant bequest to you, which will probably amount to about $560,000 after the sale of the tour company is completed.

I can not guarantee the results of the sale of the tour company, and the
will has not been officially read at this time, but I wanted to let you
know of this bequest in case you wished to pursue the matter further.
As you are out of the country, my duty will be limited to informing you
of your inclusion in his will, after which it will be up to you to
pursue the matter further if you wish.  United States inheritance law
does not require that we expend significant effort to deliver a bequest
to a foreign citizen. Nevertheless, I feel a duty to let you know your
rights.

Once again, let me share my sincere condolences on the departure of your friend and business partner.  Please let me know if there is anything I can do for you.  If you wish, I can let you know of the progress of the investigation of his death and upcoming schedules for the probate of his will.

Best wishes,

Charles Addams
